title: FireFox Performance Major Breakdown after recent updates
content:
Dear All and Mozilla Developer Team,

Since the recent updates of the Firefox the Browser Performance has become completely unsuable on Windows11 running machines. Now after tracking the browser behavior I can assure that it is the Browser and not only the entire firefox crashes daily and hourly, but also the performance has downgraded dramatically.

There is also issue with the audio and video playback, which does not come back when the video and audio playback and popups are being blcoked and then unblocked.

What I dont understand is, why the update is being pushed into püroduction when and causing millions of users to not be able to work !!!! This is completely unacceptable. Is there any test done beforehand? Who has decided that this updates must be added to MozillaQ!!!!!

how to get back to the working browser? thanks in advance for information

title: Regarding access when port number is changed
content:
I have built an HTTPS server using Apache/2.4.62 in a Linux environment using CentOS Stream release 9, but if you change the port number and access it, the behavior is different from Chrome/Edge, so please let me confirm this.

Client authentication is enabled when using port 443 or 44999 in /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf.

The server certificate has been imported to the client PC, and the client PC certificate has been imported to the server.

I attached index.html to /var/www/html/ on the server side and set it up so that test.html would open on port 44999 when the "Start" button on index.html was pressed. When I do this in Chrome or Edge, a certificate selection screen appears and when the client sends the certificate, the result is successful.

However, when I try this in Firefox, the certificate selection screen does not appear and the result is a failure. Why does the certificate selection screen not appear?

Also, when I capture the packets at this time with Wireshark, it appears that an empty Certificate packet is being sent in response to the Certificate Request from the server.

If you enter https://IP address:44999/test.html directly into the address bar, you will be able to access the page successfully.

And the contents of index.html are as follows: <title>connectTest</title> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <script> function connectTest() { var request = new XMLHttpRequest(); var testUrl = "https://192.168.137.149:44999/test.html"; request.open('POST',testUrl,true); request.send(); request.onreadystatechange = function(){ if(request.readyState == 4){ if(request.status == 200){ alert("Success"); } else { alert("Error"); } } } } </script>

コネクションテスト

<button type="button" onclick="connectTest()">開始</button>

test.html just displays "Hello World".
creator: Tatsuya.Aoki2

title: When The Firefox Starts It Kills One of My Threads
content:
Am not being hyperbole but I swear to God I love Firefox more than anything. Okay, let's get to the main topic. I have a problem with Firefox on my pc, whenever I open Firefox one of my CPU thread is dying and its causes brutally lags. I know I have a potato rig but at least fix this browser as smooth as before. After I having a problem with dying threads whenever I open a tab and going to a website I desire it took so long isgt. I thought my pc was the problem one and I think "Ah I should upgrade my pc, but I still in debt" and it turns out the Firefox was the main problem.

Please Firefox fix this for me, don't suffer me more. I'm migrating to Chrome for a while cuz the Chrome didn't kill my CPU thread (I tested it for almost 2 weeks).

I attached you images from time to time, hope you could understand it! ;)

title: Eye strain in recent Firefox versions
content:
I have noticed that in versions of Firefox newer than ESR 115.7 (and early 120s in the main release channel) I get eye strain while using Firefox. This issue didn't happen with earlier versions of Firefox - at least since the Proton UI changeover. And this issue doesn't exist on other software on my system. I haven't changed my Firefox settings.

As a result of this I haven't been able to update my installation of Firefox. I'd like to try to track down what changed around that time and see if I can find a workaround or possibly submit a bug? Is anyone familiar with graphics related changes that occurred around that time? How might I go about figuring this out? I'd like to keep up with the new features and security updates.
creator: arosenbl
